sen.j: 五代目 上村 吉彌（ごだいめ かみむら きちや、新字体：吉弥、明治42年 (1909年) 12月13日 - 平成4年 (1992年) 1月1日）は、歌舞伎役者。
sen.e: Kichiya KAMIMURA the fifth (December 13, 1909-January 1, 1992) was a kabuki actor.
Kichiya KAMIMURA the fifth (December 13, 1909-January 1, 1992) was a Kabuki (traditional performing art) actor.
sen.cmt: 歌舞伎の説明を加えました。
sen.e: Kichiya KAMIMURA the fifth (December 13, 1909-January 1, 1992) was a Kabuki (traditional performing art) actor.

sen.j: 屋号は美吉屋。
sen.e: His yago (stage family name) was Miyoshiya.
His yago (stage family name) was Miyoshiya.
His yago (stage family name) was Miyoshiya.

sen.j: 定紋は折敷型世の字。
sen.e: Miyoshiya's Jomon (family crest) was "世" in an octangle shaped like an oshiki (wooden tray with fold edges).
Miyoshiya's Jomon (family crest) was a character "世" (literally meaning the world) surrounded by an octangular-shaped frame called oshiki (wooden tray with fold edges)-kata shape.
sen.cmt: 定紋が想像できないため書き加えました。漢字"世"の説明を加えました。
sen.e: Miyoshiya's Jomon (family crest) was a character "世" (literally meaning the world) surrounded by an octangular-shaped frame called oshiki (wooden tray with fold edges)-kata shape.

sen.j: 本名は遠島 直（とおしま すなお）。
sen.e: His real name was Sunao TOSHIMA.
His real name was Sunao TOSHIMA.
His real name was Sunao TOSHIMA.

sen.j: 小芝居から歌舞伎に入り、関西歌舞伎の伝統を受継いだ女形や花車形を得意とした。
sen.e: Starting from koshibai (plays performed in small theaters), he entered the field of kabuki and was good at acting oyama (female roles) and kashagata (old female roles) following the tradition of kansai kabuki.

Having been an actor of Koshibai (plays performed in small theaters) at first, he later became a Kabuki actor with good skill in acting Oyama (female roles) and Kashagata (old female roles) inheriting the tradition from Kansai Kabuki.
sen.cmt: 小芝居でも歌舞伎を興行することから「小芝居から歌舞伎に入り・・」を書き換えました。また「受け継いだ」を書き換えました。
sen.e: Having been an actor of Koshibai (plays performed in small theaters) at first, he later became a Kabuki actor with good skill in acting Oyama (female roles) and Kashagata (old female roles) inheriting the tradition from Kansai Kabuki.

sen.j: 来歴
sen.e: Biography
Biography
Biography

sen.j: 明治42年 (1909) 大分県杵築市生まれ。
sen.e: Kichiya KAMIMURA the fifth was born in Kitsuki City, Oita Prefecture in 1909.
Kichiya KAMIMURA the fifth was born in Kitsuki City, Oita Prefecture in 1909.
Kichiya KAMIMURA the fifth was born in Kitsuki City, Oita Prefecture in 1909.

sen.j: 3歳のころから当地の歌舞伎に子役で出演。
sen.e: He started to play as a child actor in kabuki plays when he was about three years old and in 1919, he appeared on the stage of Daihaku-gekijo theater in Fukuoka City, taking the stage name of Keinosuke NAKAMURA.
He started to play in Kabuki programs presented in the area as a child actor when he was about three years old.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。「当地の」が訳漏れ。少しわかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: He started to play in Kabuki programs presented in the area as a child actor when he was about three years old.

sen.j: 大正8年 (1919) には中村桂之助を名乗って福岡大博劇場に出る。
sen.e: In 1919, he appeared on the stage of Daihaku-gekijo theater in Fukuoka City with the stage name of Keinosuke NAKAMURA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。少しわかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: In 1919, he appeared on the stage of Daihaku-gekijo theater in Fukuoka City with the stage name of Keinosuke NAKAMURA.

sen.j: 各地の小芝居を勤めたのち、昭和8年 (1933) に市川右團次 (2代目)に入門、市川右升を名乗る。
sen.e: After playing in koshibai plays in various places, he became a disciple of Udanji ICHIKAWA (the second) in 1933 and took the stage name of Usho ICHIKAWA.
After playing as an actor of Koshibai in various places, he became a disciple of Udanji ICHIKAWA (the second) in 1933 and changed his stage name to Usho ICHIKAWA.
sen.cmt: 少しわかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: After playing as an actor of Koshibai in various places, he became a disciple of Udanji ICHIKAWA (the second) in 1933 and changed his stage name to Usho ICHIKAWA.

sen.j: 昭和19年 (1944) 以降は松竹専属となり、美貌の女形として知られるようになる。
sen.e: From 1944, he was an actor under contract to Shochiku Co., Ltd., and became famous as a beautiful oyama actor.
He had exclusively belonged to Shochiku Co., Ltd. since 1944 to become famous as a beautiful Oyama actor.
sen.cmt: 以降の意味をだすためにsinceと過去分詞を用いました。
sen.e: He had exclusively belonged to Shochiku Co., Ltd. since 1944 to become famous as a beautiful Oyama actor.

sen.j: 特に 『壇浦兜軍記』の阿古屋を得意とし、連日の大入りをとった。
sen.e: Since he excelled especially at playing the role of Akoya in the play of Dannoura kabuto gunki (The War Chronicles at Dannoura) and when he played this role, the theater was filled to the rafters every day, and thus he became such a popular actor that was called "Usho for Akoya".

Especially, he excelled in playing the role of Akoya, a role of "Dannoura kabuto gunki" (The War Chronicles at Dannoura) so much that the theater was filled with big crowds whenever he played the role.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。少しわかりづらいので書き換えました。『』を""を用いて直しました。
sen.e: Especially, he excelled in playing the role of Akoya, a role of "Dannoura kabuto gunki" (The War Chronicles at Dannoura) so much that the theater was filled with big crowds whenever he played the role.

sen.j: このことから「阿古屋の右升」とまで呼ばれるほどの人気役者となった。
sen.e: Therefore he became quite a popular actor to be called 'Akoya no Usho' (nobody can equal Usho as an actor playing Akoya).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。「」を''を用いて直しました。
sen.e: Therefore he became quite a popular actor to be called 'Akoya no Usho' (nobody can equal Usho as an actor playing Akoya).

sen.j: 昭和22年 (1947)、歌舞伎座で元禄以来絶えていた名跡「上村吉彌」を襲名。
sen.e: In 1947, he succeeded to the famous stage name of "Kichiya KAMIMURA", which no one in Kabuki-za Theater had used since the Genroku era.
In 1947, he announced in Kabuki-za Theater the succession to the professional name of 'Kichiya KAMIMURA' that had been abandoned since the Genroku era.
sen.cmt: 歌舞伎座で襲名披露をしたと考え，書き換えました。「」を''を用いて直しました。
sen.e: In 1947, he announced in Kabuki-za Theater the succession to the professional name of 'Kichiya KAMIMURA' that had been abandoned since the Genroku era.

sen.j: 以後関西を中心に活動した。
sen.e: Thereafter, he performed mainly in Kansai region and played an important role in Shichinin no Kai (a kabuki study group created by seven Kamigata actors) and also in Nizaemon Kabuki as an actor who steadily supported leading players.
Thereafter, he performed mainly in Kansai region.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Thereafter, he performed mainly in Kansai region.

sen.j: 七人の会や仁左衛門歌舞伎では脇をかためる重要な役割を担った。
sen.e: In "Shichinin no Kai" (a Kabuki study group created by seven Kamigata [Kyoto and Osaka area] actors) and "Nizaemon Kabuki"(Kabuki launched by a Kabuki actor Nizaemon KATAOKA the 13th), he played important roles supporting leading players.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。少しわかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: In "Shichinin no Kai" (a Kabuki study group created by seven Kamigata [Kyoto and Osaka area] actors) and "Nizaemon Kabuki"(Kabuki launched by a Kabuki actor Nizaemon KATAOKA the 13th), he played important roles supporting leading players.

sen.j: 1974年、京都南座で片岡仁左衛門 (13代目)の『堀川波鼓』で母おぎんを勤めた後は、特に老女役が多くなった。
sen.e: After he played the role of Ogin, as a mother appearing in the kabuki play "Horikawa Nami-no-Tsuzumi" (The Drum of the Waves of Horikawa) starring Nizaemon KATAOKA (the thirteenth) at Kyoto Minamiza Theater in1974, he mainly played roles of elderly women and became known for his sophisticated yet sober style of performance.

He mainly played the roles of elderly women after the role of a mother Ogin, a role of "Horikawa Nami no Tsuzumi" (a Kabuki program based on Joruri [dramatic narrative chanted to a samisen accompaniment]), which was presented at Kyoto Minamiza Theater in 1974 by starring Nizaemon KATAOKA (the thirteenth).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。少しわかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: He mainly played the roles of elderly women after the role of a mother Ogin, a role of "Horikawa Nami no Tsuzumi" (a Kabuki program based on Joruri [dramatic narrative chanted to a samisen accompaniment]), which was presented at Kyoto Minamiza Theater in 1974 by starring Nizaemon KATAOKA (the thirteenth).

sen.j: 上品で渋みのある芸で知られた。
sen.e: He was widely admired for his performance with elegance and astringency.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。少しわかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: He was widely admired for his performance with elegance and astringency.

sen.j: なかでも『仮名手本忠臣蔵』のおかや、『攝州合邦辻』の老母おとくは一代の傑作である。
sen.e: Among the roles played by him, Okaya appearing in "Kanadehon Chushingura" (The Treasury of Loyal Retainers) and Otoku, an old mother appearing in "Sesshu Gappogatsuji" (Gappo) are magnum opuses in his lifetime.

Especially, the role of Okaya of "Kanadehon Chushingura" (a Kabuki program) and that of an old mother Otoku of "Sesshu Gappogatsuji" (a Kabuki program based on Joruri) were parts played most successfully by him in the course of his lifetime.

Especially, the role of Okaya of "Kanadehon Chushingura" (a Kabuki program) and that of an old mother Otoku of "Sesshu Gappogatsuji" (a Kabuki program based on Joruri) were most successful parts played by him in the course of his lifetime.

sen.j: 1989年、日本芸能実演家団体協議会より功労者として表彰される。
sen.e: In 1989, Kichiya was commended for his distinguished merits in kabuki by the Japan Council of Performers' Organizations.
In 1989, Kichiya was commended for his distinguished merits in Kabuki by Geidankyo (Japan Council Meeting for Performers' Groups engaged in Public Entertainment).
sen.cmt: 日本芸能実演家団体協議会の英語訳が見つからないのでこのように訳しました。芸団協は正式に使われている名称のようです。
sen.e: In 1989, Kichiya was commended for his distinguished merits in Kabuki by Geidankyo (Japan Council Meeting for Performers' Groups engaged in Public Entertainment).

sen.j: 同年勲五等双光旭日章受章。
sen.e: In the same year, he was awarded the Order of the Rising Sun, Gold and Silver Rays.
In the same year, he was awarded the Order of the Rising Sun, Gold and Silver Rays.
In the same year, he was awarded the Order of the Rising Sun, Gold and Silver Rays.

sen.j: 杵築市で上村吉弥帰郷歓迎会が行われる。
sen.e: A Kichiya KAMIMURA welcome-home party was held in Kitsuki City.
A Kichiya KAMIMURA welcome-home party was held in Kitsuki City.
A Kichiya KAMIMURA welcome-home party was held in Kitsuki City.

sen.j: 以降、脇に手利きがすくなくなった歌舞伎界でその至芸は重んじられ舞台に立ちつづけた。
sen.e: Thereafter, in the kabuki world where the number of excellent supporting players had decreased, his unrivaled performance was highly appreciated and he continued acting on stage, but finally he died of lung cancer in Kyoto.

Thereafter, with his unrivaled performance being highly appreciated in the Kabuki world, which has been suffering from a deficiency of excellent supporting players, he continued appearing on the stage
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。文後半を後列とつなげました。少しわかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: Thereafter, with his unrivaled performance being highly appreciated in the Kabuki world, which has been suffering from a deficiency of excellent supporting players, he continued appearing on the stage

sen.j: 肺癌のため京都で死去，享年82。
sen.e: His age of death was 82.
He died of lung cancer in Kyoto at the age of 82.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He died of lung cancer in Kyoto at the age of 82.
